thread.title: Stocks lower as Fed minutes keep rate increase in play

title: Stocks lower as Fed minutes keep rate increase in play
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Wed, Aug 19, 2015, 21:41 BST - UK Markets closed Stocks lower as Fed minutes keep rate increase in play Stocks fall, following global sell-off; Fed minutes show bank still pondering rate hike By Ken Sweet, AP Business Writer | Associated Press – 33 minutes ago View Photo 
FILE - In this Oct. 2, 2014 file photo, people pass a Wall Street subway stop, in New York's Financial … 
NEW YORK (AP) -- U.S. stocks are closing down as investors react to mixed signals from the Federal Reserve that an interest rate hike in September was still being debated. 
The Dow Jones industrial average fell 162 points, or 0.9 percent, to end at 17,349 Wednesday. The Standard & Poor's 500 index lost 17 points, or 0.8 percent, to 2,080 and the Nasdaq composite fell 40 points, or 0.8 percent, to 5,019. 
Energy stocks fell as the price of oil plummeted. 
In the minutes from the Federal Reserve's July meeting, Fed officials appeared to move closer to raising interest rates for the first time in nearly a decade but were concerned about the risks of a significant economic slowdown in China to the U.S. Tax cuts, pensions, childcare, online accounts and beer duty, here's … Related Stock Articles Follow the quotes you care about most.
